thread.title: Spicer Shoots Down MSNBC Reporter’s Suggestion Trump Must Have A Health Care ‘Plan B’ [Video]
thread.title_full: Spicer Shoots Down MSNBC Reporter’s Suggestion Trump Must Have A Health Care ‘Plan B’ [Video]

author: Randy DeSoto
title: Spicer Shoots Down MSNBC Reporter’s Suggestion Trump Must Have A Health Care ‘Plan B’ [Video]
text:
Jackson followed up that response by asking, “At this point is there an acknowledgement that there does need to be a Plan B, if this vote does not happen tonight?” 
“No. Plan A,” Spicer fired back. 
As reported by Western Journalism , House Speaker Paul Ryan rescheduled the vote on the AHCA from Thursday night until Friday morning, indicating he was not able to reach the 215 votes needed to pass the bill. 
The Associated Press reported at least 28 Republicans said they opposed the bill — but the number was in constant flux amid the eleventh-hour lobbying. If 22 Republicans join united Democrats in voting no, the bill will fall short of passage. 
The House Freedom Caucus, made up of approximately 30 conservative Republicans, currently stands in opposition to the bill, contending it does not do enough to dismantle the structure of ObamaCare, including removing regulations they believe result in higher health care insurance premiums. 
Freedom Caucus chairman Mark Meadows, R-N.C., said on Capitol Hill Thursday afternoon that “we have not gotten enough of our members to get to yes at this point. … However, I would say progress is being made,” Politico reported . 
Meadows praised Trump’s negotiating efforts as he seeks to find the legislative balance needed to bring conservative and moderate Republicans on board. Advertisement - story continues below
